SourceString: An old jar, stoppered so tightly that it can\'t be opened.
This jar is definitely talking...
Strange Jar
This sword belonged to Kaenas, a warrior of Pyrgos.
A family heirloom sword, old but well-oiled and sharp.
Kaenas\'s Sword
This marks you as a member of the Pyrgos militia.
A weathered iron pin, reused over the years.
Militia Badge
A charm containing the spirit of the divine horse Areion. A gift from your mentor, Aristonoe.
It\'s made from a metal you can\'t identify, and thrums with magical warmth.
Areion\'s Charm
Once Nemesis\'s divine tool, used to re-absorb her spent divine energy, the Moirai arranged for it to fall into your hands.
It swirls with dark power that responds to your touch.
Dye Phial
A piece of the God of the Wild’s horn, sliced off in combat.
It pulses with strange power and smells of deep forests.
Pan\'s Horn
A militia commander in the enclave will likely want to see this.
A piece of a mother crab\'s shell. Crabs seem to be repulsed by it.
Iridescent Crab Shell
The key ingredient in brewing a cure to a Gorgon snake\'s petrifying bite.
The blood of a vanquished Gorgon snake.
Gorgon Snake Blood
A potion that should cure a Gorgon snake\'s petrifying bite.
A concoction made using the blood of a vanqished Gorgon Snake.
Snake Bite Cure
A broken head piece of a larger statue that could be reassembled... if one had all the pieces.
A sculpted stone likeness of the sea-god Glaukos... or, his head at least.
Broken Statue Head
A broken staff belonging to a larger statue that could be reassembled... if one had all the pieces.
The staff this stone likeness represents seems to have been fashioned from a boat\'s oar.
Broken Statue Staff
A broken tail piece of a larger statue that could be reassembled... if one had all the pieces.
A sculpted fish-like tail, broken off from a larger stone figure.
Broken Statue Tail
A broken torso piece of a larger statue that could be reassembled... if one had all the pieces.
The mighty stone likeness of an oceanic god\'s torso.
Broken Statue Torso
A tool given to you by Nephele to restore the overrun graveyard.
The warm scent of frankincense helps to calm the dead.
Incense
The militia commander in Pyrgos will certainly want to see this.
The symbol of command for an ichthian warrior--a tooth ripped from the mouth of a shark during one of their dark trials.
Commander Medallion
An ancient coin from a bygone era, found on the beach where I washed ashore.
It\'s strangely warm…
Large Bull Coin
An ancient coin from a bygone era, found on the beach where I washed ashore.
It\'s strangely warm…
Large Bull-Faced Man Coin
An ancient coin from a bygone era, found on the beach where I washed ashore.
It\'s strangely warm…
Large Serpent Coin
The end looks like it\'s meant to fit into a socket.
The symbol of Hermes, a winged staff entwined by two serpents.
Caduceus
The favorite snack of Stolos\'s cows.
Green, fresh and tasty.
Chicory
A potion brewed to sober up Stolos.
Smells like fresh herbs and mint.
Tincture of Clarity
A sign of friendship between man and monster.
This rock is pretty, but doesn\'t look particularly valuable.
Shiny Stone
Restores what has been transformed.
Moly, the gods call it, and it is hard for mortal men to dig; but with the gods all things are possible.
Moly Root
The beauty of this flower is enough to drive even the staunchest heart to despair. What magical creature was it stolen from?
The longer you behold the flower, the more difficult it is to look away...
Sacred Lily
An alchemical ingredient.
Gooey remains of a magical spider.
Spider Excretion
A key found amid ichthian smoke signals.
A simple iron key.
Key
Two coppers rings used to symbolize a couple’s engagement.
They’re crusted with sea salt and specks of blood.
Betrothal Rings
A glowing crystal found in some Mycenaean Ruins.
This crystal pulses with warmth.
Crystal
A rough map, created to find the treasure of Queen Erana\'s golden hoard.
Rough parchment with a hasty map and scribbled annotations.
The skull of a golden skeleton.
It\'s cold to the touch.
Golden Skull
Treasure Map
Chelonis requested this for his lunch.
A fresh, crunchy cabbage.
Cabbage
A key found in an old Mycenaean prison.
The cold iron of the key is centuries old.
Cell Key
Gorgo, the hunter trader at the shipwrecked crew\'s camp, will likely want to see this.
A unique piece of shell from a crab egg.
Crab Eggshell
This opens a pirate\'s cage.
A crudely-fashioned key.
Cage Key
An old memento belonging to Kallias, at the Travelers\' Refuge.
The beloved toy of a child.
Lost Toy
An oddity found near an ichthian sacrificial pool.
A skull with a small rune carved in it, perhaps part of a sacrifice.
Ichthian Skull
An oddity found near an ichthian sacrificial pool.
A skeletal hand, cleanly severed, like a grisly offering.
Ichthian Claw
An oddity found near an ichthian sacrificial pool.
The bones of this skeletal foot pulse with energy - a gift?
Ichthian Skeletal Foot
Coins such as this were used for good luck by the Mycenaeans.
An ancient bronze coin, smooth from many hands.
Bronze Coin
A key found in ruins near a statue of Poseidon.
It looks like it opens something valuable...
Chest Key
Three talking statues were arguing over this...
An apple made of solid gold.
Golden Apple
Grants more energy regeneration, but slower movement, when thrown into the ritual fire for the Contest of Champions.
Sweet-smelling incense used in centaur rituals.
Styrax
Grants more elemental damage, but less energy, when thrown into the ritual fire for the Contest of Champions.
Hardened, gummy incense used in centaur rituals.
Frankincense
Grants more elemental resistances, but less elemental damage, when thrown into the ritual fire for the Contest of Champions.
Smoky, spicy resin used in centaur rituals.
Myrrh
Grants more defense, but less offense, when thrown into the ritual fire for the Contest of Champions.
A blunt piece of iron used in centaur rituals.
Blunt Iron
Grants faster attacks, but slower movement, when thrown into the ritual fire for the Contest of Champions.
A heavy lump of iron used in centaur rituals.
Heavy Iron
Grants more offense, but less defense, when thrown into the ritual fire for the Contest of Champions
A piece of jagged iron used in centaur rituals.
Jagged Iron
Sewer Key
A vial of blood taken from King Ixion.
The blood bubbles with strange heat...
Blood of Ixion
Opens the way into Ixion\'s ruined palace.
An ancient key from a bygone era.
Ixion\'s Palace Key
An old handle.
This must slot in somewhere...
Lever Handle
Can be activated by a scholar of warfare.
Distilled essence of a sacrifice, blessed by a god.
Blood of Ares
Incense found on a priest\'s corpse. Used to calm the dead.
Old Incense
Can be used to gain the attention of certain lost souls.
The battle flag of a defeated regiment.
Lost Regiment Banner
Can be given to someone who will feed the hungry of Tegea.
Demeter\'s legendary horn of food that never empties.
Horn of Plenty
Can be smelted in divine flames on Olympos
A rare material used in constructing ancient shrines and other heavenly items.
Ethereal Ore
Can be given to a leader of these troops
A symbol of the rebellion with a peacock scratched into the back side.
Rebel Medallion
The skull of a wolf.
Old, faded bone from a long-dead beast.
Wolf Skull
The skull of a wolf.
Old, faded bone from a long-dead beast.
Wolf Skull
It belonged to a man who was recently cursed as a wolf for sacrificing his family.
A simple key.
Leandros\'s Key
Opens the Ares Temple crypt.
A blood-covered key to the crypt under Ares\'s Temple ruins
Ares Temple Crypt Key
Opens the Sanctum of the Ares Temple\'s catacombs.
An old key.
Temple Sanctum Key
Sykara\'s Blood Vow
Sykara\'s Blood Vow
Can be used to unlock a memory of combat at ritual shrines.
The skull of a fallen hero from ages past. It pulses with strange power.
Aristomenes\' Skull
Can be used to unlock a memory of combat at ritual shrines.
An amulet inscribed with the words: \"Rage not against Fate, my love. We will meet again in Elysium.\"
Dysepilogos\' Amulet
Can be used to unlock a memory of combat at ritual shrines.
A feather plucked from the body of a vanquished gryphon.
Ajax the Magnificent\'s Feather
Can be used to unlock a memory of combat at ritual shrines.
A coral-like fragment of bone from a hippokampos.
Hippokampos Vertebra
A tooth ripped from the jaw of the ichthian king. It pulses with strange power.
King-of-Tides\' Tooth
Can be used to unlock a memory of combat at ritual shrines.
A tooth ripped from the jaw of the ichthian king.
King-of-Tides\' Tooth
Can be used to unlock a memory of combat at ritual shrines.
A piece of the God of the Wild’s horn, sliced off in combat.
Pan\'s Horn
A tuft of hair ripped from Skirion\'s monstrous form. It pulses with strange power.
Skirion\'s Mane
A tuft of hair ripped from Skirion\'s monstrous form.
Skirion\'s Mane
A scale shed from Skylla\'s monstrous form. It pulses with strange power.
Skylla\'s Scale
Can be used to unlock a memory of combat at ritual shrines.
A scale shed from Skylla\'s monstrous form.
Skylla\'s Scale
A twisted fragment of bone from a corrupted hippokampos. It pulses with strange power.
Feral Hippokampos Vertebra
Can be used to unlock a memory of combat at ritual shrines.
A twisted fragment of bone from a corrupted hippokampos.
Feral Hippokampos Vertebra
A jagged splinter from Ixion\'s flaming wheel. It pulses with strange power.
Burning Splinter
Can be used to unlock a memory of combat at ritual shrines.
A jagged splinter from Ixion\'s flaming wheel.
Burning Splinter
Replica Aegis of Athena
A shield that belongs with a statue of Athena.
Athena\'s aegis is a powerful divine artifact. This, however, is just a replica.
Coated in a grimy film.
A key to the Tegea Sewers.
Ichthian Cage Key
A primitive key.
